info.p: MPEG is not a format. It is an "an alliance of working groups established jointly by ISO and IEC that sets standards for media coding, including compression coding of audio, video, graphics, and genomic data; and transmission and file formats for various applications" (Wikipedia). And, of course, it is a heavily underspecified way of talking about various audio and video formats, which are too many to group them together.

In the Standards Information System, MPEG is classified as a "hub format" -- as mentioned at the top of this document. Centres are strongly encouraged to either pick one of the already described "MPEG" varieties (see below), or create a description of an MPEG-family format (or suggest that someone else create such a description, by introducing a new ID in the centre's recommendations; first one may wish to check among our "missing formats" if an appropriate ID has already been suggested).
